QuestionStatement: If in a specified year nominal gross domestic product grew by 11 percent and real gross domestic product grew by 4 percent, inflation for this year would be
Which of the following is an example of structural unemployment?
AnswerChoices: A computer programmer who leaves her job to move to Florida
A worker who loses his job during a recession
An autoworker who is replace by a robot
A construction worker who is always unemployed during the winter months
A worker who is engaged in unproductive work

QuestionStatement: What would be the effect of a large increase in labor productivity on the real gross domestic product and price level?
AnswerChoices: A
B
C
D
E

QuestionStatement: Which of the following means of reducing military spending would have the greatest positive impact on gross domestic product for the United States?
AnswerChoices: Combining two domestic military bases into one overseas base
Cutting retirement benefits to military personnel
Closing overseas military bases and relocating those operations to the United States
Closing overseas military bases and laying off military personnel
Canceling contracts with domestic producers for new airplanes

QuestionStatement: The real value of the United States dollar is determined by
AnswerChoices: Federal regulations regarding purchasing power
The value of the gold backing the dollar
The goods and services it will buy
The money multiplier
The marginal propensity to consume

QuestionStatement: An increase in which of the following is most likely to cause an improvement in the standard of living over time?
AnswerChoices: Size of the population
Size of the labor force
Number of banks
Level of taxation
Productivity of labor

QuestionStatement: The consumer price index measures which of the following?
AnswerChoices: The change over time of the weighted prices of a particular group of goods and services
The change over time of the weighted wholesale price index
The change over time of the difference between the gross domestic product deflator and the wholesale price index
Inflation corrected for changes in the real gross domestic product
Inflation corrected for changes in the wholesale price index

QuestionStatement: Which of the following is true if the economy is producing at the full-employment level of output?
AnswerChoices: The unemployment rate is zero
No person is receiving unemployment compensation from the government
There is frictional unemployment
The government’s budget is balanced
The balance of trade is in equilibrium

QuestionStatement: Which of the following groups of people would benefit from unanticipated inflation?I.      SaversII.      BorrowersIII.      Lenders
AnswerChoices: I only
II only
III only
I and II only
I and III only

QuestionStatement: An increase in the labor force participation rate will
AnswerChoices: Increase investment and decrease savings
Increase savings and decrease investment
Have no effect on unemployment
Make it easier to reduce unemployment
Make it more difficult to reduce unemployment

QuestionStatement: An increase in which of the following is most likely to increase the long-run growth rate of an economy’s real per capita income?
AnswerChoices: Population growth
The proportion of gross domestic product consumed
The educational attainment of the population
The supply of money in circulation
Personal income taxes

QuestionStatement: Which of the following transactions would represent an addition to a nation’s current gross domestic product?
AnswerChoices: Ms. Smith purchases a share of stock in an automobile company
A retailer increases her stock of imported shoes
The government increases its domestic purchases of food for use by the military
A corporation sells shoes from last year’s inventory
A mother sells her car to her daughter

QuestionStatement: If real gross domestic product is increasing at 3 percent per year and nominal gross domestic product is increasing at 7 percent per year, which of the following is necessarily true?
AnswerChoices: Unemployment is increasing
The price level is increasing
Exports exceed imports
The economy is in a recession
The government is running a budget deficit

QuestionStatement: The official unemployment rate is not an accurate indicator of actual unemployment in the economy because
AnswerChoices: Structural unemployment is greater than cyclical unemployment at the going wage rate
Full employment is greater than natural unemployment
The unemployment rate is less than natural unemployment
The official rate does not include persons who have given up looking for work
The official rate does not reflect the number of people receiving unemployment compensation

QuestionStatement: Which of the following would best explain a decline in potential gross domestic product?
AnswerChoices: Negative net investment
The discovery of a vast new oil deposit
A lower price level
A decrease in the infant mortality rate
A decrease in wages and profits

QuestionStatement: As a measure of economic welfare, gross domestic product underestimates a country’s production of goods and services when there is an increase in
AnswerChoices: The production of military goods
The production of antipollution devices
Crime prevention services
Household production
Legal services

QuestionStatement: Unexpected increases in inventories usually precede
AnswerChoices: Increases in inflation
Increases in imports
Stagflation
Decreases in production
Decreases in unemployment

QuestionStatement: If the money stock decreases but nominal gross domestic product remains constant, which of the following has occurred?
AnswerChoices: Income velocity of money has increased
Income velocity of money has decreased
Price level has increased
Price level has decreased
Real output has decreased

QuestionStatement: If purchases of education and medical care were counted as investment rather than consumption, gross domestic product would
AnswerChoices: Not change, because there is no change in total expenditures
Increase, because investment is included in gross domestic product but consumption is not
Increase, because consumption is included in gross domestic product but investment is not
Decrease, because investment is weighted more heavily than consumption in calculating gross domestic product
Decrease, because consumption is weighted more heavily than investment in calculating gross domestic product

QuestionStatement: The major difference between real and nominal gross domestic product (GDP) is that real GDP
AnswerChoices: Excludes government transfer payments
Excludes imports
Is adjusted for price-level changes using a price index
Measures only the value of final goods and services that are consumed
Measures the prices of a market basket of goods purchased by a typical urban consumer

QuestionStatement: Which of the following statements exemplifies the concept of structural unemployment
AnswerChoices: New entrants into the labor force have trouble finding jobs
Workers leave their current jobs to find better jobs
Workers are laid off because aggregate demand has declined
Workers are fired because consumers have reduced their total expenditures
Workers are fired because their skills are no longer in demand

QuestionStatement: Assume that for consumers, pears and apples are substitutes.  It is announced that pesticides used on most apples may be dangerous to consumers’ health.  As a result of this announcement, which of the following market changes is most likely to occur in the short run in the pear market?
AnswerChoices: A
B
C
D
E

QuestionStatement: Under which of the following conditions would consumer spending most likely increase?
AnswerChoices: Consumers have large unpaid balances on their credit cards
Consumers’ wealth is increased by changes in the stock market
The government encourages consumers to increase their savings
Social security taxes are increased
Consumers believe they will not receive pay increases next year

QuestionStatement: Changes in which of the following factors would affect the growth of an economy?I.  Quantity and quality of human and natural resourcesII.  Amount of capital goods availableIII. Technology
AnswerChoices: I only
I and II only
I and III only
II and III only
I, II, and III

QuestionStatement: The unemployment rate measures the percentage of
AnswerChoices: People in the labor force who do not have jobs
People in the labor force who have a part-time job but are looking for a full-time job
People who do not have jobs and have given up looking for work
People in the adult population who do not have jobs
People in the adult population who have temporary jobs
